intro: Rinorea goudotiana, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Rinorea goudotiana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
